column4: I have installed 10.04 x86_64 on a intel SSD... i can't find any howto etc. on how to optimize ubuntu for SSD... any help is appreciated
set vm.swappiness low (assuming you have > 1Gb RAM. This will reduce writes to /swap
you can use vm.swappiness of 0 then
do i just have to write it in a shell?
run: gksudo gedit /etc/sysctl.conf    and  add these lines. http://pastebin.com/8UJuGsKA
just change the swappiness to 0, the swappiness keeps the apps in ram and makes the OS not use swap unless you have exhausted RAM (not going to happen)
the other fluff makes your web access faster
some of it isn't, just paste the text and next boot you should be ok. I hope you used ext2 for the SSD, it reduces writes as ext3 and ext4 use a journal
do i need to reload some services or even reboot for it to take effect?
ext4 writes quite a lot to the journal, using ext2 makes it write a LOT less so will prolong the SSDs life
